title: GA5 Question 8 Clarification
content: I need clarification on Question 8 of GA5. Should I use gpt-4o-mini which AI proxy supports, or gpt-3.5-turbo as mentioned in the question?
raw_content: I need clarification on Question 8 of GA5. Should I use gpt-4o-mini which AI proxy supports, or gpt-3.5-turbo as mentioned in the question?

title: GA5 Question 8 Clarification
content: You must use gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, even if the AI Proxy only supports gpt-4o-mini. Use the OpenAI API directly for this question. The assignment specifically requires this model for proper evaluation.
raw_content: You must use `gpt-3.5-turbo-0125`, even if the AI Proxy only supports `gpt-4o-mini`. Use the OpenAI API directly for this question. The assignment specifically requires this model for proper evaluation.

title: Token Counting for Cost Calculation
content: How do I count tokens accurately for the cost calculation part? Should I use the same tokenizer as the model?
raw_content: How do I count tokens accurately for the cost calculation part? Should I use the same tokenizer as the model?

title: Token Counting for Cost Calculation
content: Yes, use the tokenizer corresponding to the model you're using. For gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, you can use the tiktoken library with the 'cl100k_base' encoding. Count both input and output tokens for accurate cost calculation.
raw_content: Yes, use the tokenizer corresponding to the model you're using. For gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, you can use the tiktoken library with the 'cl100k_base' encoding. Count both input and output tokens for accurate cost calculation.

title: Installation Issues with OpenAI Package
content: I'm getting an error when trying to install the openai package. The error says 'Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement'. How can I fix this?
raw_content: I'm getting an error when trying to install the openai package. The error says 'Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement'. How can I fix this?

title: Installation Issues with OpenAI Package
content: Try upgrading pip first: pip install --upgrade pip. Then install the openai package: pip install openai==1.12.0. Make sure you're using a recent Python version (3.8 or higher).
raw_content: Try upgrading pip first: `pip install --upgrade pip`. Then install the openai package: `pip install openai==1.12.0`. Make sure you're using a recent Python version (3.8 or higher).
